    RshinyHelpers

    A small package of utility functions for various applications

    Intro üë£

    The package is a combination of utility functions for data tidying and data manipulation that don‚Äôt fit into any tidy workflow. For beginners do please see the tidyverse packages dplyr and tidyr for data manipulation and reformatting.

    This is my first hack at creating an R package and I don‚Äôt anticipate maintaining or committing to CRAN. Nor do I advise using in production for these reasons. I welcome all feedback!

    Usage

    Install the development version from GitHub üëâ 

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("aarong1/RshinyHelpers")

    Example 

    library(Rpack)
## basic example code

    Shiny

    We can change individual slider colours in bootstrap

    This applies to the individual slider components. We appy by referenceing the index of the bootstrap slider in the order in which they appear in the ui. See the docs for more on this

    We can change the default row selection colour on DataTables from the DT package.

    and have really nice styled and formatted value boxes

    Making them reactive is easy! As is formatting the colour to suit your dashboard‚Äôs aesthetics

    Text tidying

    rmPWCap(c('He1l0 ! W0rId'),rm_all_white_space = F)

    [1] ‚ÄúHE1L0 W0RID‚Äù

    rmPWCap(c('He1l0 ! W0rId'),rm_all_white_space = T)

    [1] ‚ÄúHE1L0W0RID‚Äù

    Error finding

    chk_nas()

    simply wraps

    which(is.na(data.frame))

    where as

    chk_dups()

    simply wraps which entries in a dataframe is duplicated

    which(duplicated(data.frame))
